body: @tillrohrmann can you have a second look at the changes? (Travis already gave a green light on my branch with S3 tests enabled, the PR results will give the results without S3 tests due to missing credentials)
(rebased onto the newest #4939 which should fix the test failures shown by Travis on the previous build here)

This is my branch with the end-to-end tests: https://github.com/aljoscha/flink/tree/finish-pr-4961-s3-shading-fixing
thx @tillrohrmann , removed the redundant import.

@elbaulp au contraire, thank you for fixing this bug. Do we need quotes for the following?

line 69: pid=$FLINK_PID_DIR/flink-$FLINK_IDENT_STRING-$DAEMON.pid
line 181: done < ${pid}.tmp
line 182: rm ${pid}.tmp
@greghogan Oh, of course, didn''t saw it, how many $pids! Done.
unfortunately, it seems we cannot minimize the shaded `jar` or it will not contain non-imported/dynamically-loaded classes like this one
@zentol , cool! Thanks for reviewing it!

This improvement is indeed very clean and reduce many redundant `Override` methods by extending `PooledByteBufAllocator` directly. 

But I am still confused of one thing. In previous way, we created the `PooledByteBufAllocator` with `preferDirect` parameter as true, and the created allocator will be used in client and server. So it seems no chance to allow the heap buffer in original allocator in netty code. Or I missed or mis-understood some key informations?
LGTM. Thanks for your contribution @yew1eb. Merging.
Will remove the comment and then merge the PR. Thanks for your review @zentol.
Thanks for your review @zentol. Merging.

Thanks for spotting and fixing this! 👍 

I'm merging.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-7765 - this is a parent issue enclosing fixing other modules. Split between other subtasks is very, very arbitrary, but I guess next milestone would be to enable convergence in `flink-runtime`, while tackling the issue of `flink-shaded-hadoop`.
Yes, but I think this is making an assumption about the internal implementation. If someone changes that the test could break/not test the right thing anymore.

In the rocksdb implement, it still use db.merge to add each element to the rocksdb.
I think we can get the specific MergeOperator class from rocksdb config and merge the list as a string.
So we can only use db.put once to update the list.

I had to modify the PR more than i initially expected.

I removed the option to disable the new behavior again; after thinking about it more i came to the conclusion that silently losing data is never an acceptable behavior.
I also rewrote the tests to be more straight-forward.
@greghogan @naeioi have done some changes in both TPCHQuery3.scala and TCPCHQuery3.java
Thanks for the review! 😃

1) yes, I have tested the changes on a YARN cluster as described in the PR comment (before the changes on the unit tests)
2) regarding the `pom.xml` changes: I actually took those `from flink-filesystems/flink-s3-fs-hadoop/pom.xml` where these were added by 991af3652479f85f732cbbade46bed7df1c5d819 and 36b663f4561458408ee68902a1db6a5cd539e1c2 and can only guess why @StephanEwen and @zentol used this way except for what you proposed. Maybe they can clarify.
I did include your end-to-end tests (with some fixes) and the fixes for the errors they found. Should be fine now, let's see what travis says...
Thanks @aljoscha for merging!

Hi, @zentol , thanks for reviewing this PR. I recalled that I put a [caveat ](https://ci.apache.org/projects/flink/flink-docs-release-1.4/dev/connectors/cassandra.html#checkpointing-and-fault-tolerance)about this potential data loss in the latest C* connector documents. Since this fix is committed, would you like me to open another PR just to remove that warning message from document?

Hi @yunfan123  Thanks for the feedback, and I agree with you.

Well, here's the problem: Flink seems to be using the StringAppendTestOperator as merge operator from RocksDB, which added a ',' between values. But I didn't find how a java class for StringAppendTestOperator. 

Shall we mimic StringAppendTestOperator and concatenate the values with ',' ourselves? Do you have any more suggestions?

No. I don't think this is going to be a suitable solution, as if = is allowed in the comparison, the very same file will be triggered multiple times.

Note that the older and deprecated `FileMonitoringFunction` solves this situation by having a map of filenames to modification times. More robust but also more expensive memory-wise. A limit to a possible map could be given in `LinkedHashMap` with `removeEldestEntry`.
Perhaps access time could be leveraged. However, as of Flink 1.3.2 `FileStatus#getAccessTime()` (at least for a local file system), always returns `0` ...
Hi, Do I need to do something more in order to this PR be merged?

Flink use StringAppendOperator as merge operator. It used in org.apache.flink.contrib.streaming.state.PredefinedOptions.
It use native java method. 
Can we use the native method to merge our list?

@yunfan123 sorry I can't find where `PredefinedOptions` defines it. Isn't Flink using RocksDB's `StringAppendTESTOperator` in `RocksDBKeyedStateBackend`? And the [`StringAppendOperator` java class](https://github.com/facebook/rocksdb/blob/master/java/src/main/java/org/rocksdb/StringAppendOperator.java) in rocksdbjni doesn't expose any methods for us to use.

Hi @aljoscha , do you have insightful suggestions?

I think excluding dependencies without declaring them explicitly has the disadvantage that this relies implicitly on another dependency to pull in the right versions. Once this dependency is removed or its version bumped the whole build might fail because it no longer pulls in the dependency.
Turns out this doesn't work, we also have to remove the genjavadoc plugin.

I don't know if there's a way of retrieving the class behind the `"stringappendtest"` merge operator. If not, we should just simulate the behaviour of appending with commas in Java code. @StefanRRichter what do you think?

@aljoscha IIRC there is no class for `StringAppendTESTOperator ` in the  RocksDB Java API. You can only pass a string that is used inside some factory in the native RocksDB code to instantiate the append operator. I would also suggest to simulate it, either "shallow" by adding commas or "deeper" by using a dummy RocksDB instance internally to actually perform the merge and query for the result.

Did you use the branch that has both commits? Not the first PR that doesn't have the `maven-bundle-plugin` fixes?
For me it does work locally but it could be an issue that I have something in my caches that you don't have. Which would be bad because then it wouldn't work on the buildbot either.

@PangZhi No updates, because I was on vacation and we currently give priority to the release 1.4 testing. After that I will finish this, but from the review comments, I would not expect that there are many changes to what I implemented and this can be merged as soon as there is time to do so.
Wait I might build the wrong branch. Let me check it again.

At the same time, pinning a dependency version can cause problems if a dependency is upgraded and requires another jackson version.

There isn't a perfect solution. The current approach works as long as the aws dependency pulls in jackson, which is less likely to change compared to it bumping the version used.
It worked. +1 for this.
Thanks for the update @kmurra. I will go over the changes a last time and merge this.

This look even better now! Waiting for Travis and then I'll merge.

Thanks! 😃
Thanks @GJL ! Will merge this.
Maybe we can reduce the number of ITCases in this PR and add tests to `CompositeAccessTest` instead.

Yes, I noticed that as well. I tried to add a test to `CompositeAccessTest` but this doesn't not work with the test base class, because the optimizer removes the `Calc` node which results in a `ClassCastException`.

Instead I merged some of the ITCases.
CC @aljoscha
This is true, however, I think that in case of doubt the more explicit solution should be preferred, because it is more predictable.
@fhueske I updated this PR and added generic parameters as well.
Could you please close the PR if it doesn't auto-close?

+1 tests are passing and the 1.4 release has been forked so we're at the start of a new release cycle

This looks good! 👍 

Please make sure to merge onto `master` as well as `release-1.4`.

Thanks for the work!  The code looks good to me. 

+1

So we pin the version, update aws at some point (and forget to check the dependency), and now we got a sleeper failure because there may be a single code-path that fails due to a version mismatch.

On the other hand, a missing dependency fails on every single code path that uses it.

There is no doubt in my mind, let's stick to the one that's easier to debug.

Besides, a lone dependency management entry isn't particularly explicit anyway; why is it there, for which dependencies is it needed; explicitness comes through gratuitous use of comments in this case.

Shouldn't we already have the problem of the sleeper failure by excluding Hadoop's dependency?

Agreed that a dependency management entry would require comments to explain it, but so does the exclusion, too.
yes there could be a sleeper failure in hadoop, but there's nothing we can do to fix that besides relocating jackson in either hadoop or aws, which is probably not possible.
merging.

merging.

Sure, I can merge it immediately if you want.
LGTM! 👍
Thank you for fixing this, merging.
Thanks!
Thanks for the comments @tillrohrmann . I addressed them.
Changes look reasonable to me. I supposed we can't guard this with a test? (maybe we can, by adding something to the classpath that looks like the native hadoop libs)
I don't think we have a choice other than trusting your analysis and loop-testing. Looks good to merge! 👍

This would be difficult to test - the most reasonable test would be to put the Hadoop JNI into the classpath and then run the end-to-end test on that but we don't want to include the platform-dependant jni library, I suppose

Some more info that i just stumbled on:

This doesn't actually happen on master, or on release-1.4 for that matter.

For FLINK-7419 we're adding another relocation pass to flink-dist for jackson, and this appears to trigger the error.

`master: succeeds`
`+ relocation in flink-dist: always fails`
`+ asm dependency bump: succeeds`
Will rebase the PR and merge it once travis is green.
